page.title: 20THE HERONRY
page.content: The Heronry in Chilham is very important for the village because the Heron has become the village emblem. The Heronry is found in the casle estate and it is very ancient, going back to the original Domesday book. There is a village legend that if after their migration the Herons do not return by Valentine's day(February 14th.), something unfortunate will happen to the Lord of the castle. There are about 6 to 8 nests in the Heronry now and the Heron is quite a common bird in the village. The Heron, with it's long, sharp, bill, long legs and neck can often be seen in the castle estate. They can be seen around the castle lake and other ponds and streams feeding on fish and frogs.
